name: Linz
fun_fact: Fun fact: Linzer Torte is the world's OLDEST CAKE RECIPE, with the earliest known recipe dating to 1653 in a manuscript from Countess Anna Margarita Sagramosa at Admont Abbey‚Äîmaking this almond-spiced pastry with red currant jam over 370 years old!

hero_dishes.name: Linzer Torte
hero_dishes.description: Crumbly shortbread pastry made with ground nuts (hazelnuts, walnuts, or almonds), cinnamon, and lemon zest, filled with red currant jam and topped with a lattice crust
hero_dishes.origin_story: The oldest known cake in the world! The earliest recipe from 1653 was found in Codex 35/31 at Admont Abbey, adapted from Countess Anna Margarita Sagramosa's manuscript. Later recipes from 1696 were long thought to be the oldest. Originally made with red currant jam, though raspberry and apricot are now common. It's the oldest cake named after a city. The Jindrak bakery in Linz produces over 100,000 Linzertorte cakes annually using traditional methods.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Jindrak bakery (makes the 'Original' Linzer Torte, over 100,000 annually), caf√©s throughout Linz, traditionally served with whipped cream and sugar dusting
